intro: Gastrolepis alticola, commonly known as the mountain gastrolepis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
